alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 1:16PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Ohio and northwest Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in northeast Ohio, Ashtabula. In northwest Pennsylvania, Erie. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through the afternoon hours. Rainfall rates are around a third to half an inch per hour in the lake effect rain. However, much of this is falling in areas that have seen over 4 inches of rain the last several days. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Some minor flooding has been reported in the city of Erie and western Erie County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Erie, Ashtabula, Conneaut, North East, Girard, North Kingsville, Waterford, Albion, Wattsburg, Northwest Harborcreek, Harborcreek, Lawrence Park, Wesleyville, Lake City, Kingsville, Cranesville, Platea, McKean, and Avonia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
